content.label: Although there is enough space on my iPad (3GB) it is impossible to download the game. Every time I try I get the error message that there is not enough space. I restarted the iPad several times, deleted the app, reinstalled it, deleted content but still it doesn't work. It would be great to have support as this game seems to be very good.
This is one of my favorite game in iPad and highly recommend this. If you enjoy detective/adventure type of game, you will definitely enjoy this one.

I have been playing graphic adventure games since 1989 (initially on my Amiga 500), so it's refreshing to see these games been brought back to life on iOS. This said, The Last Express is by far the worst in this category: terrible controls, super-low quality graphics (ever heard of remastering?) and somehow even requires a humongous amount of disk space (1.3GB). Buyers beware: play Monkey Island, Broken Sword, or even Simon the Sorcerer or Beneath a Steel Sky before remotely considering this game.
Excellent update of an old favorite. Game mechanics improved for use with iPhone/pad. I'd love to see more retro adventure games for iOS.
What a classic! I was so happy to see it released again as a mobile app.

A beautiful classic. I love how the iPhone version uses portrait orientation. A beautiful game with beautiful story. It animates as if it is a powerpoint slide show but for me it is a artistic choice. It rarely crashes. Some touch control might be a little quirky. But this is an amazing game. A classic that still holds up well today. Buy it.
Bought the game with high hopes based on reviews. Flow and actions don't make much sense even with hints. If you want good point and click adventure go for hector and monkey island series.

The game will appear antiquated in playing style, but remember that this is a remake of an old computer game. This game was and is a masterpiece, and the audio problems others are having is gone of Rome.
Apparently this is a port of a classic.  Mostly it's just obnoxious looking around and some utterly miserable combat.   The controls could not be more infuriating.
One of the best adventures of all times, an 1997 game, which still feels fresh after all this years. A must buy for adventure fans.

It is so hard to find a game of this quality!!  DOTEMU has done a magnificent job designing this app.  The price is way lower than one would expect.  It's not an easy game, but it doesn't cut you off completely when you make a mistake, and believe me, I've made a lot of them!  Please make more apps similar to this; I love Last Express!  THANK YOU!
It is fun I only played it on my pc not on my iPad
Have always loved this game on PC. Glad to see it remade.

The original Last Express is a classic. The port manages to modernize it nicely, though navigation is still a pain at times, and it is very difficult to know where exactly you are on the train at times. Also, I was prompted to rate the game while I was playing, which was very intrusive. Would be more tolerable if that request happened when I was in the menu.

If you were never much of a point and click game player, the mechanics may drive you insane. Things have to be done in a certain way at certain times, or else you'll get it. Love the graphics, characters, and history, though.

title.label: Brilliant but needs subtitles for hearing impaired

content.label: This is a brilliant classic game, but is unplayable if you have trouble hearing or can't play with the sound on.

I  remember playing this game as a kid and I had no idea how to play it. given now in 2012 this game makes a lot more sense and it is still pretty difficult to play if you don't understand what's going on. This game is definitely how I remembered.

I cried a little when I heard this game was finally coming out for the iOS. This a game that was truly ahead of its time when it was released in the 90s. It was obscure then because of Broderbund going bankrupt, but that seems like it was meant to be.
Pretty good game if u can stay on track...

I played this back in 1997 and loved the comic-book style graphics then. I was thrilled to see this game given new life in iOS. Graphics are excellently done and reveal character emotion surprisingly well. The story is a gem in and of itself with enough fun and suspense, action and romance, to to keep the player entertained to the end.

I approached this game seeing it as a very popular, masterpiece of gaming back in 1997. Though not successful commercially, and though being very old, I wanted something new. This game is brilliant.  Less a game than an interactive murder mystery movie, there are many brilliant aspects to this game.  It is set perfectly in pre-World War 1 Europe on the most famous train ever. The game perfectly captures the experience of being on a train, from different sleeping cars, to the dining car, restaurant car, baggage car, and even captures the service that European train conductors provided.  The characters are very well developed, and you will know each very well by the end, and like and dislike some.  The voice acting is brilliant, with over 800 pages of it, and interesting conversations everywhere. Music aids the story well. And my favorite part of the game is that it is real time. There may be multiple conversations going on at once on the train, in different cars. And you have to choose between some of them. You will rarely miss something important, but its this concept that brings the game to life and let's you play this story as if you we're really this.  

What I didn't like we're a few game crashes. I'm running an iPad mini, and maybe had 3 crashes, but the game was never affected. Still, kinda irritating in some parts. And the gameplay is very old. Icons are close together and jumbled, and figuring out what each does on the train takes time and practice. By the end it won't affect the story, but at first you may feel trapped and lost. Now graphics are hit or miss. These are old graphics, and in some areas its like an artistic painting, where the painting just moves about.  In others, the graphics really show age, and just look old. But I do feel that it will grow on you after some time.  But I am glad they didn't remake the game at the same time because it really feels like you're watching a piece of art in story form, that you play.

All I have to say, is this game is one of the best story lines out there, and I'd say its better than console games like Assassins Creed, Alan Wake, Halo, etc. This game is an experience. This tops my list of apps recommended for people, and I highly recommend it for anyone (except young children, who may not appreciate the game, will get confused, or won't understand the game).

Don't ask yourself if its worth it or not, because at the end of the day, I feel like it is an experience into classic gaming and pure gaming narrative art that anyone and everyone should have at some point.
So much fun. I've played it through about three times now. The story, the gameplay, the interactions, the amount of thought required, the graphics; it is all amazing. Very well done.

title.label: Quits when I start it on iPad

content.label: The game sounds great! I hope that there is a way I can actually play it! I've tried deleting and reinstalling it, but that didn't  help.
This is "The Game". Good story and beautiful art. I immediately felt like I am in that train. So thrilled, my palms are getting sweat. Just buy it!

Still the best adventure game that I've ever played. I've probably played this game once a year for several years and it does not cease to impress me. The story is suspenseful and engrossing, the atmosphere is heady and beautiful, the characters feel like real people, and the music is sublime. It feels more real even with its dated graphics than newer games. I so wish they made more games like this. Anyway, I cannot recommend this enough.

I don't understand all the glowing reviews. Poor graphics & pretty boring; on the pricey side for what you get. This game needs some serious  improvement. I wish it was designed more like The Walking Dead game.

Have played this on both my iPhone and iPad 2 with absolutely no sound issues. It is a beautifully animated game with an immersive storyline and real time events - highly recommended! A must for any gamer or history buff.
Game looks beautiful but audio doesn't work. Please update and fix ASAP

title.label: Classic adventure gaming, in your pocket!

content.label:
Visually stunning, amazing audio, immersive mystery story! You dont need to understand French, but if you do it adds to the experience. The spoken French is very well scripted & acted, as is the English.

Please, app developers, more games like this! I can't put it down.
Great game

This was one of the greatest PC/Mac adventure games ever created and won countless "game of the year" awards when it came it --back in 1997. Cool rotoscope graphics, dramatic soundtrack, good voice-over acting, compelling mystery story and interesting characters. Truly an interactive movie where you play a key role in unraveling the story.

DotEmu has converted it to run as a native iOS app and it works great. I use the iPad version and have had no problems. Controls are super easy, animation and sound are smooth. Note that this game is much more about the story, characters, clues and timing than about action. For $5 it's a great bargain.
Love this game
One of the best but lesser known adventure games of all times. No sound issues on my ipad2. A classic!

I have the PC version of this classic game. This is a well-developed & designed iOS version of this game & it actually looks & feel better than the original PC version!

I love that the game is now divided into chapters & there's character bios. It makes the game experience much, much more enjoyable. 

I don't experience any of the issues reported by other users so far. Both the audio & video work great. Other than a crash once, this game is perfect.

I downloaded this game and before I made it through the first chapter realized that the animations were buggy. I do have sound but the animations track and leave blips of prior images behind. Personally there are too many good games out there to mess with bugs.
Looks like it might be fun, if there was sound.

No audio on iPad 2. Yes, my volume is up. And yes, audio works in other programs. I was hoping this update would fix it. Wish they'd at least have a closed captioning option. The game is unplayable without audio.

I'd expect this kind of thing back when the game was first created and there were a lot of hardware incompatibilities, but on an ipad?!
I bought this game years ago and never got around to playing it. I'm so glad it has been rereleased on a current generation platform! Awesome port too. Grab it and enjoy!

Absolutely awesome role playing game. I think it was originally released over a decade ago, but it has been updated obviously for the iPad. The game controls can be a little awkward, but not bad enough to hurt the overall enjoyment. Best of all, it's a great story too. I definitely recommend this, but don't start it unless you have hours to spend because once you start, you'll be hooked. 

My only complaint is that I can't watch the bonus features. The app crashes when I try. 

I also really wish they had created a sequel to this game. I'd pay money for it.
Controls are rough but it's still an incredible game. Very very engaging story. Loved finally getting into this world after hearing about the game for so long.

I read a lot, and always skip cut scenes in games because they're garbage. 
The Last Express is shockingly well-written; I read the reviews in PC Gamer way back in the day, but I was still surprised. The atmosphere is on point, too. You're essentially playing a Hitchcock movie. It just illustrates that when you care about something it shows in the final product, props to the creator, great game!
This is a gem. New gamers might not have the patience for a game like this. And I would say: give it a chance. Modern games have a lot to learn from this title.

title.label: Was and Still is one of the Best Games ever made.

content.label: I never thought The Last Express would ever be on IOS but now that it is I am hooked once again. I recommend playing on an iPad if you have access to one. Love this game so much.
Game crashes on my Iphone 4S when I click on play. Cant even start the game, please fix!

title.label: Excellent port of an excellent game

content.label: This overlooked classic was a big step forward for adventure games - if you're a fan of the genre you owe it to yourself to check it out!

Frustrating. Game keeps ending as I just begin to explore. First time I searched compartment 1, pulled cord: game over. Resumed, and simply trying to leave comp 1, man enters room: game over. Third time, get out of comp 1, go down hall, meet guy in fez in nearby compartment, unlock his bio, he closes his door, kid runs down hallway, and I go one click down hallway: game over. I'm about to dump the game.

When I finished this game on PC many years ago, I watched the ending and wondered: when am I going to play this again? Of course, I never did...until now.

When I first started up this version, I wondered if I had succumbed to nostalgia. The animation is truly not at it's best in the first few minutes. But once the control is handed to the player, you're confronted with a mystery that is immediately compelling, and it all unfolds from there: the rotoscoped graphics, the train's passengers, full of secrets to uncover, the beautiful style and design of the early twentieth century. I'm completely hooked...again.

The game is fairly demanding in what it expects from you: pay attention to what your fellow passengers say and do, or you will miss valuable clues that might save your bacon later. I remember lots of frustrated wandering when I first played this game, but a new clue system is helpful to figure out what should be next on your agenda. My biggest complaint are the touch controls, and they are a bit finicky. Fix them and this game is on it's way to a fifth star.

Where's my Grim Fandango iOS game?
Great game, but the touch controls need some work.

Like others, I played and loved this game on my PC many years ago. I am thrilled to have it again. 

My only criticism is that the touch controls could be improved. I often end up accidentally moving back and forth in the train cars, when really I'm just trying to get through to the end. I also find myself sitting down when I don't mean to. 

Otherwise, great!
the touch system is laggy
